title: Looking to start a high school club?
body:
Hey!

http://i.imgur.com/r0w3bw4.png


We believe our community is the most important aspect of our game. We believe together we can change the perceptions of what gaming means to teachers and parents. League of Legends is more than a game to us, it’s a passion, a lifestyle and where we met our friends. It’s filled with big wins, tough losses and epic comebacks. With your help we can highlight some similarities to traditional sports, this may be a great way to talk to parents and teachers about League of Legends. Teamwork, leadership, communication and discipline are required in sports and League of Legends, and that could be key in sharing why League isn’t a whole lot different than your friends playing rugby. We want to make it easier for teachers and parents to see this in our game. We are asking you to join us in creating a great experience for League of Legends players in high school.


We've just released our high school club directory, which you can find here - https://oce.leaguehighschool.com/

The high school website should provide all the information you need to start a club at your school! So make sure to have a look around and check out the FAQs.  If you have any other questions after looking around let me know below and I will try my best to help.

replies.body: A teacher told me he will get back to me over the weekend just like 30mins ago
awesome, let me know how it goes.

Hey guys i also need help setting up the club at my school. I go to Rosebank college and will love some help to get it started i have talked to all the teachers i know that play games and know what esports is. i also have many players in my school that are interested in it but they dont want to help me get it started....
Have you showed them the website and especially the resources and success stories available?
yes i have emailed them all the website and i have told them in person about some of the success stories

Hey, 

How did you go with setting up a high school club?

Thanks
Conquisitor
Have you tried showing them all the players that want to start a club? how many at your school roughly?

Most people in my school are from Bronze 5 - Diamond 4 (Theres around 20 that i know who play)

Also i know most people would be interested in tournaments vs other schools

We had a self made tournament against 2 other school before which was fun (we all were bronze to gold), will there be a way to organize these with these new high school clubs?

Thanks - Fakers Scrotum (Paz)

> [{quoted}](name=Fakers Scrotum,realm=OCE,application-id=NjEElsTI,discussion-id=NaRxUi2E,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-04-25T06:53:07.850+0000)
>
> Most people in my school are from Bronze 5 - Diamond 4 (Theres around 20 that i know who play)

I didnt type the full question but my teacher probably wont allow this club unless we have some "learning material" so i was just wondering under teachers resources if you could maybe put pro games so everyone of all skill ranks could learn something together, and help each other out with new strats like lane swaps etc?

Hey

We plan to upload more material to the teacher resource section on the high school hub. What this looks like should be careful planned out with the help of some teachers, so that we provide resources which are truly valuable. 

Could you see if your teacher would be happy sharing their ideas directly with me?

Thanks
Conquisitor

Hi,

It's awesome that there are players in your school interested. The website is for you to work with your school to start up a club. There are a lot of resources available for teachers to learn about League of Legends and what a club may do together.

Get your teacher involved and we get work out what the best way to support them is.

> [{quoted}](name=ImFakersScrotum,realm=OCE,application-id=NjEElsTI,discussion-id=NaRxUi2E,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-04-25T07:04:24.086+0000)
>
> I didnt type the full question but my teacher probably wont allow this club unless we have some "learning material" so i was just wondering under teachers resources if you could maybe put pro games so everyone of all skill ranks could learn something together, and help each other out with new strats like lane swaps etc?

you can just show her a lcs game on youtube or plays tv
Will there be able to have a state wise tournament? I can see this being very successful at least in NSW{{item:3086}}
Maybe one day. But first we really want to build out the infrastructure and relationships with schools. Have you got a club going at your school yet?
Yes teacher said next school day we'll be putting up all the details :D
nice! look forward to seeing a new school on the directory soon.

Do the clubs at school get sponsored by Riot?
Because it might be hard for me to convince the school to make this club without any progress in return

The schools and teachers will get in direct contact with Riot. We will be offering support and help to clubs depending on what they are doing. There are a lot of resources available on the website for teachers to learn about League of Legends and what a club may do together.
is there different divisions for different ranks? eg bronze v bronze plat v plat etc

Hey Rengar1shot,

The website is for you to work with your school to start up a club. There are a lot of resources available for teachers to learn about League of Legends and what a club may do together. There is also a tournament guide so your club could definitely run tournaments like your suggestions.
if clubs have tournaments will riot give them prizes of normal tournaments like triumphant ryze etc?
That is definitely possible!
but could this be with a smaller amount of people, most tournaments that get the pool prize done by riot are often quite large and that might  be more difficult for smaller high school clubs

> [{quoted}](name=FuriousFlameDude,realm=OCE,application-id=NjEElsTI,discussion-id=NaRxUi2E,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-04-22T11:35:01.110+0000)
>
> but could this be with a smaller amount of people, most tournaments that get the pool prize done by riot are often quite large and that might  be more difficult for smaller high school clubs


Alot of them would just be a skin- legacy item- RP gift or something. It's  not always about money, you forget... they make these pixel at no cost other than manpower. Once it's on the database... they can pass them out at will. 

It'll be Riot implementing a system that allows clubs to genuinely have tournaments, not just internal.

And i don't like the fact...

This directory is for "high school" 

just open it up as a directory for everyone.

small 100character club descriptions etc and people can browse and apply...


Guess they gotta pander to the kids using parents money for points.

Hey FuriousFlameDude

Thanks for the message.  It's great to see your passion for clubs. Are you interested in setting up your own club? 

I'd be happy to help you if you'd like me to. 

Best regards
Conquisitor
i do have my own club already but i think u meant to  put n "total virgin." instead of my name. but if you would like to join my club i would love that :D
i talked to a teacher today about it and emailed him that link. He told me his been trying to get the same thing going but for DOTA instead. He told me he just has to talk to our principal about it
Awesome. I'm happy to talk to your Teacher to explain more about the initiative or answer any questions they may have.  You can  contact me at OCE-Highschool@riotgames.com

Yeah im currently in the middle of writing an essay about it and i have a few people helping me from school and from a facebook group im in :) i will get a bunch of my friends to come help me when im ready to show the teacher the essay =D

the teacher resources at the bottom of this page (see link below) will help you.

http://promo.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/high-school-clubs/teacher-resource.html
Sorry for late response havent been on the website in a while the teachers said no... :(

Check out the website, it has some interesting stories and could convince the teacher.

Also try to get a big group of you together to ask =D that way it shows that there is a lot of interest among the students to have this kind of club.
hello
hi
just another question would the high school clubs have their own tournaments (like the uni ones)
Maybe one day. But first we really want to build out the infrastructure and relationships with schools.
Yes i have
i think there is like 50-100 players at my school but not entirely sure

Have you tried showing them all the players that want to start a club?

Have you shown teachers the website at school? they may not have looked at your email.

anyone?

do you have any idea on what i could do??
